item.title: Pointers
item.description: What are pointers? In programming, a pointer is a derived data type (like arrays, structs, and unions). Instead of storing values like normal types, pointers store memory addresses of another data objects. Hence the name pointer, because these addresses “point” to some data. So that is all a pointer is: a memory address that points to some data. We will see how they prove to be very useful and how to use them in the C programming language.
